body_html:
I have one more complex question other than just subtract.

Say, still maximum 4GB gpu memory, I need the operation like below, I've confirmed this will lead to OOM error:

    A = tf.Variable(tf.zeros([5000, 25])) # 500KB
    temp1 = tf.tile(A, [1, 5000]) # 2.5GB
    temp2 = tf.reshape(temp1, [5000, 5000, 25])
    _temp2 = tf.reshape(temp1, [5000, 5000, 25]) - A # OOM error.
    temp3 = temp2 - A
    temp4 = tf.square(temp2)
    temp5 = tf.reduce_sum(temp2, 2)
    temp6 = tf.reshape(temp5, [5000, 5000])

    sess = tf.Session()
    sess.run(tf.initialize_all_variables())
    sess.run(temp1) # run successfully
    print "temp1"
    sess.run(temp2) #  run successfully
    print "temp2"
    sess.run(temp3) # OOM error
    print "temp3"
    sess.run(temp4) # OOM error
    print "temp4"
    sess.run(temp5) # OOM error
    print "temp5"
    sess.run(temp6) # not execute.
    print "temp6"

So, I don't know why you all @zffchen78 @rmlarsen say that it won't expand intermediately.
Or, is my code wrong?

PS: I use tensorflow 0.8.0rc0.

body:
I have one more complex question other than just subtract.

Say, still maximum 4GB gpu memory, I need the operation like below, **I've confirmed this will lead to OOM error**:

``` python
    A = tf.Variable(tf.zeros([5000, 25])) # 500KB
    temp1 = tf.tile(A, [1, 5000]) # 2.5GB
    temp2 = tf.reshape(temp1, [5000, 5000, 25])
    _temp2 = tf.reshape(temp1, [5000, 5000, 25]) - A # OOM error.
    temp3 = temp2 - A
    temp4 = tf.square(temp2)
    temp5 = tf.reduce_sum(temp2, 2)
    temp6 = tf.reshape(temp5, [5000, 5000])

    sess = tf.Session()
    sess.run(tf.initialize_all_variables())
    sess.run(temp1) # run successfully
    print "temp1"
    sess.run(temp2) #  run successfully
    print "temp2"
    sess.run(temp3) # OOM error
    print "temp3"
    sess.run(temp4) # OOM error
    print "temp4"
    sess.run(temp5) # OOM error
    print "temp5"
    sess.run(temp6) # not execute.
    print "temp6"
```

So, I don't know why you all @zffchen78 @rmlarsen say that it won't expand intermediately.
Or, is my code wrong?

PS: I use tensorflow 0.8.0rc0.
